title: Image from 2017 viral as Aamir Khan recently met Turkish President Erdogan
author: www.altnews.in
vclaim:
An image of Bollywood actor Amir Khan with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is being circulated on social media with the claim that the duo met recently.

On February 18, Anant Gandhi, who to claims to be a member of Ahmedabad BJP IT cell, posted (archive link) the viral image and said, “Why did film actor Aamir Khan go to Turkey to meet Turkish President? Turkey’s anti-India and pro-Pakistan war continues. (फिल्म अभिनेता आमिर खान तुर्की के राष्ट्रपति से तुर्की मे मिलने क्यों गये??तुर्की का भारत विरोघ और पाकिस्तान प्रेम जग जाहिर हे।)”

It is noteworthy that Erdogan raked up the issue of Kashmir in the Pakistani parliament on February 14 and offered to support Pakistan’s stand. The Turkish President had made a similar statement in the United Nations last year.

Another Twitter user posted (archive link) the image and said, “The jihadi President of Turkey who opposed India for the removal of section 370 in UNO… the one who supports Pakistan openly and just visited Pakistan two days ago…Aamir, the pig who feels scared in India, has gone to this enemy.” This tweet was retweeted over 150 times.

Similarly, several other accounts posted the viral image on Twitter.

Alt News did a reverse image search on Yandex and found the viral image onGetty Images. According to the stock photo agency, the picture was clicked in Ankara, Turkey on October 6, 2017, by Kayhan Ozer.

A News Nationreport from October 8, 2017 states Khan met President Erdogan to promote his film ‘Secret Superstar’ at the Presidential Complex in the Turkish capital Ankara.

Therefore, the social media claim that Khan met Erdogan after the latter’s recent comment on section 370 is false. Khan met President Erdogan in 2017 for a movie promotion.
